question_text: Why are antenna wires routed through the laptop lid instead of inside the base?
answer_options: To reduce electromagnetic interference from the CPU
To allow the laptop to boot faster
To place the antenna higher when the lid is open
To keep the keyboard area free of wires
correct_answer: To place the antenna higher when the lid is open
explanation: Routing antennas through the lid raises them for better signal reception once the screen is opened.
